intro: Aeschynomene oligantha, commonly known as smallleaf aeschynomene, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. It is also known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, which makes it a valuable plant for soil enrichment.
